title: Edgar Allan Poe National Historic Site: Learn About the Park
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park           Learn About the Park        The reading room at the Edgar Allan Poe National Historical Site is furnished according to Poe's essay "The Philosophy of Furniture." NPS Photo   Â    Edgar Allan Poe has delighted people of all ages with his macabre tales and haunting poems. At the Edgar Allan Poe National Historic Site visitors can explore the rooms that Poe called home and discover why Poe considered his time in Philadelphia as the most productive years of his short literary career. Looking to find out more about the Edgar Allan Poe National Historic Site?   Teachers can find lesson plans and suggested readings for their classrooms, as well as plan a field trip to the site in our Education pages. In our Kids & Youth page you can download a Junior Ranger Activity Booklet before visiting. If you'd like a preview of the site, check out our Photos & Multimedia section.
